extends Camera

    • Method Detail

      • cameraSettings

        boolean cameraSettings(boolean captureMode,
                       long exposureTime,
                       int x0,
                       int x1,
                       int y0,
                       int y1,
                       short xbin,
                       short ybin)
        Pixis Specific settings. Behaves identically to cameraSettings but includes pixis specific binning xbin, ybin.
        Parameters:
        captureMode -
        exposureTime -
        x0 -
        x1 -
        y0 -
        y1 -
        xbin -
        ybin -
        Returns:
        TRUE if the given settings are valid.

      • stopCapture

        boolean stopCapture(int option)
        Stops the capture sequence of the camera base on the passed option.
        Parameters:
        option - - {0) CCS_NO_CHANGE: No change - (1) CCS_HALT: Halt all CCS activity, put in idle state - (2) CCS_HALT_CLOSE_SHTR: Close the shutter, then do CCS_HALT - (3) CCS_CLEAR: Put the CCS in the continuous clearing state - (4) CCS_CLEAR_CLOSE_SHTR: Close the shutter, then do CCS_CLEAR - (5) CCS_OPEN_SHTR: Open the shutter, then do CCS_HALT - (6) CCS_CLEAR_OPEN_SHTR: Open the shutter, then to CCS_CLEAR
        Returns:

      • getBits

        int getBits()
     throws java.io.IOException
        Get the bit depth for the currently selected speed choice.
        Returns:
        the bit depth
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getCcsStatus

        int getCcsStatus()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the status of the camera control subsystem (CCS)
        Returns:
        ccs_status The CCS status. One of: - (0) IDLE - (1) INITIALIZING - (2) RUNNING - (3) CONTINUOUSLY_CLEARING
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getClearCycles

        int getClearCycles()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the clear cycles parameter
        Returns:
        the number of times the CCD is cleared
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getClearStrips

        int getClearStrips()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the clear strips parameter
        Returns:
        the number of strips per clear
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getFrameCapable

        int getFrameCapable()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Determine whether this camera can run in frame transfer mode (set through PARAM_PMODE)
        Returns:
        1 if the camera is frame capable, 0 if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getGain

        int getGain()
     throws java.io.IOException
        Get the current gain setting
        Returns:
        the gain setting (the meaning of the gain is camera dependent)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getGainMultEnable

        int getGainMultEnable()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the on/off indicator for the gain multiplication functionality
        Returns:
        1 if enabled, 0 if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getGainMultFactor

               throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the gain multiplication factor
        Returns:
        the multiplication factor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getMaxGain

        int getMaxGain()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Get the maximum gain setting for the camera
        Returns:
        the maximum gain setting (camera dependent; may be as high as 16)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getReadoutPort

        short getReadoutPort()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Get the CCD readout port

        Possible readout port values (the available ports are camera-specific; use ccd_get_readout_port_entries to determine the number of available ports):

        • READOUT_PORT_MULT_GAIN = 0
        • READOUT_PORT_NORMAL = 1
        • READOUT_PORT_LOW_NOISE = 2
        • READOUT_PORT_HIGH_CAP = 3
        Returns:
        the port number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getReadoutPortEntries

        int getReadoutPortEntries()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Get the number of available readout ports
        Returns:
        the number of entries in the speed table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getRetries

        int getRetries()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Get the maximum number of command retries. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Returns:
        the maximum number of retries
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getShtrCloseDly

        int getShtrCloseDly()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the shutter close delay in milliseconds
        Returns:
        the delay in msec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getShtrOpenDly

        int getShtrOpenDly()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the shutter open delay in milliseconds
        Returns:
        the delay in msec
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getShtrStatus

        int getShtrStatus()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the status of the shutter
        Returns:
        The shutter status. One of: - (0) SHTR_FAULT: Shutter has overheated - (1) SHTR_OPENING: Shutter is opening - (2) SHTR_OPEN: Shutter is open - (3) SHTR_CLOSING: Shutter is closing - (4) SHTR_CLOSED: Shutter is closed - (5) SHTR_UNKNOWN: The system cannot determine the shutter state
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getSpeed

        int getSpeed()
      throws java.io.IOException
        Get the time for each pixel in nanoseconds
        Returns:
        the actual speed for the current speed setting
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getSpeedEntries

        int getSpeedEntries()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Get the number of speed table entries
        Returns:
        the number of entries in the speed table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getSpeedMode

        short getSpeedMode()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Get the CCD readout speed from a table of available choices
        Returns:
        the table index
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getTimeout

        int getTimeout()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Get the maximum time to wait for acknowledgement. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Returns:
        the timeout setting in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getTmp

        float getTmp()
      throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve the current temperature of the ccd
        Returns:
        the measured temperature of the CCD, in degrees centigrade
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • getTmpSetpoint

        float getTmpSetpoint()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Get the temperature setpoint of the ccd
        Returns:
        the desired temperature of the CCD, in degrees centigrade
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a communication error has occurred.

      • setClearCycles

        boolean setClearCycles(int clearCycles)
        Set the clear cycles parameter
        Parameters:
        clearCycles - the number of times the CCD is cleared
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • setGain

        boolean setGain(int gain)
        Set the current gain setting
        Parameters:
        gain - the gain setting (the meaning of the gain is camera dependent)
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • setGainMultEnable

        boolean setGainMultEnable(int enabled)
        Turn the gain multiplication functionality on or off
        Parameters:
        enabled - 1 if enabled, 0 if not
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • setGainMultFactor

        boolean setGainMultFactor(int factor)
        Set the gain multiplication factor
        Parameters:
        factor - 1 if enabled, 0 if not
        Returns:
        1 if enabled, 0 if not

      • setReadoutPort

        boolean setReadoutPort(short port)
        Set the CCD readout port choice

        NOTE: The gain, speed, and bit depth may be altered as a result of setting this parameter. You should maintain a list of available readout ports and associated settings, and set all of them after calling this function.

        Parameters:
        port - the readout port index
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • setRetries

        boolean setRetries(int retries)
        Set the maximum number of command retries. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Parameters:
        retries - the maximum number of retries
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

        Set the shutter close delay in milliseconds
        Parameters:
        shtrCloseDly - the delay in msec
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

        Parameters:
        shtrOpenDly - the delay in msec
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

        boolean setSpeedMode(short speed)
        Set the CCD readout speed from a table of available choices.
        Parameters:
        speed - the table index
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • setTimeout

        boolean setTimeout(int mSec)
        Set the maximum time to wait for acknowledgement. This should normally not be changed since it "is matched to the communications link, hardware platform, and operating system" [PVCAM 2.6 Manual, p. 36]
        Parameters:
        mSec - the timeout setting in milliseconds
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • setTmpSetpoint

        boolean setTmpSetpoint(float tmpSetpoint)
        Set the temperature setpoint of the ccd
        Parameters:
        tmpSetpoint - the desired temperature of the CCD, in degrees centigrade
        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • shtrOpenNever

        boolean shtrOpenNever()
        Close the shutter, and do not open it during exposures.

        Equivalent to setting the PARAM_SHTR_OPEN_MODE parameter to OPEN_NEVER

        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure

      • shtrOpenNormal

        boolean shtrOpenNormal()
        Open the shutter during exposures.

        Equivalent to setting the PARAM_SHTR_OPEN_MODE parameter to OPEN_PRE_EXPOSURE

        Returns:
        1 on success, 0 on failure
